Sentencas: The electrochemical performance of a La0.8Sr0.2MnO3 (LSM) cathode electrode of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) was promoted by the infiltration of metallic (Ag) and ceramic (La0.8Sr0.2FeO3 (LSF), CeO2) nano-catalysts.
Titulo: Enhanced performance of La0.8Sr0.2MnO3 cathode for solid oxide fuel cells by co-infiltration of metal and ceramic precursors

Sentencas: Electrochemical and microstructural techniques were used to investigate the effects of the addition of the infiltrated materials.
Titulo: Enhanced performance of La0.8Sr0.2MnO3 cathode for solid oxide fuel cells by co-infiltration of metal and ceramic precursors

Sentencas: The SEM observations showed that a well-dispersed arrangement of catalyst nano-particles is formed on the micron-sized LSM backbone.
Titulo: Enhanced performance of La0.8Sr0.2MnO3 cathode for solid oxide fuel cells by co-infiltration of metal and ceramic precursors

Sentencas: Electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) along with the analysis of distribution of relaxation time (DRT) and polarization measurement were conducted using a three electrode configuration setup.
Titulo: Enhanced performance of La0.8Sr0.2MnO3 cathode for solid oxide fuel cells by co-infiltration of metal and ceramic precursors

Sentencas: The EIS results revealed that the effect of the Ag nano-catalyst in lowering the polarization resistance is more sensible at lower temperatures, whereas LSF has more impact on the reduction of polarization resistance at higher temperatures.
Titulo: Enhanced performance of La0.8Sr0.2MnO3 cathode for solid oxide fuel cells by co-infiltration of metal and ceramic precursors

Sentencas: The best performance enhancement was achieved by the co-infiltration of Ag-ceria into the LSM electrode.
Titulo: Enhanced performance of La0.8Sr0.2MnO3 cathode for solid oxide fuel cells by co-infiltration of metal and ceramic precursors

Sentencas: The co-infiltration of Ag and ceria reduced the polarization resistance of the electrode to 2.5% of that for the pure LSM electrode.
Titulo: Enhanced performance of La0.8Sr0.2MnO3 cathode for solid oxide fuel cells by co-infiltration of metal and ceramic precursors

Sentencas: Furthermore, the infiltration of Ag solution reduced the electrode overpotential by about 114% at 700 degrees C. (c) 2017
Titulo: Enhanced performance of La0.8Sr0.2MnO3 cathode for solid oxide fuel cells by co-infiltration of metal and ceramic precursors
Enhanced performance of La0.8Sr0.2MnO3 cathode for solid oxide fuel cells by co-infiltration of metal and ceramic precursors
